wikipedia_page.main: Ronald Clifton Brooks (3 March 1899 – 14 August 1980)  was an English first-class cricketer and British Army officer. Eitherside of a career as a partner in the family firm, Brooks served in the First World War and the Second World War, gaining the Military Cross in the former. While studying at the University of Cambridge, he also played first-class cricket for Cambridge University Cricket Club.

response: *Ronald Brooks (1899–1980), first-class cricketer and British Army officer
